Package com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model

Class GnarledRootBeast

java.lang.Object
com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model.Character
com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model.GnarledRootBeast
public class GnarledRootBeast
extends Character
The GnarledRootBeast is an extended sub-class of Character class. It acts as a type of role module with special skills and reaction in the game. Users can choose a role generated by the program based on this class module.
Author:
Wentao Lu

  • Constructor Details

    • GnarledRootBeast

      public GnarledRootBeast()
      no-argument constructor for the GnarledRootBeast object. This will set up the maximum health and strength using Random function and initialize the current health for the player.

    • GnarledRootBeast

      public GnarledRootBeast​(int maxHealth, int currentHealth, int strength)
      This is a parameterized constructor overwriting the upper class constructor. It allows user to set up the parameter of the role manually.
      Parameters:
      maxHealth - the maximum health of the character
      currentHealth - the current health of the character
      strength - the strength of the character

  • Method Details

    • attack

      public Attack attack()
      This is an overwrote function to invoke the attack instruction. The method will set up a damage rate and decide what type of damage it will apply by using a simple algorithm containing a preset number and a Random method.
      Specified by:
      attack in class Character
      Returns:
      the Attack information about the damage amount it contains

    • defend

      public AttackReport defend​(Attack attack)
      This is an defense method that allows the player to take different reaction when facing different types of attacks. The Magic Moose eats wood and heals for half of the intended damage, up to max health recovery.
      Specified by:
      defend in class Character
      Parameters:
      attack - the attack object set up by the character's opponent.
      Returns:
      the defend report showing the actual damage that has been caused.
